key_channel_insights.line_content: OTA channel prices are predominantly consistent with the airline's website at 63%, but competitiveness is declining as lower prices drop to merely 7.19%.
The MSE channel showcases robust pricing with 73% of fares lower than the airline's own offerings, significantly enhancing its market appeal.
The GDS channel exhibits a concerning trend with over 92% of fares being higher than the airline's prices, presenting a significant challenge for competitive positioning.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: Approximately 63% of OTA channel prices are consistent with the airline's website for the latest week.
The proportion of lower OTA prices dropped to 7.19% last week, indicating a declining competitiveness.
17.51% of OTA listings were priced higher than the airline's website last week, showing a notable presence of discrepancies.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: No offers were available on the OTA channel, highlighting a potential gap in inventory for 12.71% of sampled itineraries last week.
The same price status remained strong at 62.59% for the latest week, reaching a high of 72.57% in the previous month.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: Short haul routes showed a consistent 64.95% same price rate last week despite a small increase in higher pricing incidents to 13.86%.
Long haul pricing remained stable with 44.90% reflecting the same prices as the airline's site, but only 2.04% offered lower prices.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: In Singapore, 78.16% of the OTA prices matched the airline's offerings, but around 8.74% were priced higher.
Non-Singapore originating sales displayed 47.62% consistent pricing with slight increases in higher priced listings at 25.71%.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in bookings maintained a high of 59.29% stable pricing, however, the frequency of higher prices increased to 16.79%.
Far out bookings reflected good consistency at 68.84%, yet showed 18.84% billed at higher prices, revealing a wider price strategy.

mse_highlights.line_content: Approximately 73% of observed fares in the MSE channel were lower compared to the airline's own site in the last week.
The proportion of fares that were the same between the MSE channel and the airline site slightly increased by 3.92% in the latest week.
Only 0.24% of fares in the MSE channel were higher than those on the airline site, indicating minimal pricing discrepancies.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: In the latest week, about 4% of the offerings were not available on the MSE channel.
For the latest week, the same pricing status constituted 23%, reflecting a solid competitive positioning of the MSE channel.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: Short haul fares were 73% lower on average in the MSE channel during the latest week, enhancing competitive advantage.
The long haul segment showed a lower price status of 68.75% in the latest week, maintaining consistency with previous trends.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: In the SG origin group, 84.95% of fares were lower on the MSE channel last week, maintaining affordability for this key demographic.
The Non-SG origin group had a slightly lower percentage of 60.66% lower prices, indicating more competitive pressure.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close in bookings showed a significant lower price status of 69.64% in the latest week, enhancing last-minute travel options.
Far out bookings maintained a lower price status at 78.83%, demonstrating strong competitive rates for advanced bookings.

gds_highlights.line_content: The GDS channel shows a high frequency of fares that are higher than the airline's website, accounting for over 92% of bookings for both short and long-haul journeys.
Only 0.24% of GDS bookings offered lower fares than the airline's website in the latest week, indicating limited competitive pricing on the GDS channel.
The average price differences remain consistent with a slight upward trend compared to previous months, particularly for long-haul flights, where the difference rose by 2.22%.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: In the latest week, 92.81% of bookings reflected higher fares on the GDS channel compared to the airline's website, maintaining similar levels from prior weeks.
The percentage of offers found to be the same between the GDS and the airline's website remained negligible, with no significant change over the past month.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: Short-haul tickets showed 92.41% higher fares on the GDS channel, slightly less than long-haul tickets at 95.83%, indicating a trend of higher pricing across all regions.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Singapore point-of-origin fares were 93.20% higher on the GDS channel, mirroring the trend of costlier fares across both SG and Non-SG routes.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: For bookings made close in, 89.29% reflect higher fares on GDS, indicating a strong pattern of increased costs for last-minute bookings.
